 29 /*global JXG: true, define: true*/
 30 /*jslint nomen: true, plusplus: true*/
 31 
 32 /* depends:
 33  see define call
 34  */
 35 
 36 /**
 37  * @fileoverview In this file the Comb element is defined.
 38  */
 39 
 40 define([
 41     'jxg', 'options', 'utils/type', 'base/constants', 'base/line', 'base/polygon', 'base/point'
 42 ], function (JXG, Options, Type, Const, Line, Polygon, Point) {
 43 
 44     "use strict";
 45 
 46     /**
 47      * @class A comb to display domains of inequalities.
 48      * @pseudo
 49      * @name Comb
 50      * @augments JXG.Curve
 51      * @constructor
 52      * @type JXG.Curve
 53      * @throws {Error} If the element cannot be constructed with the given parent
 54      *  objects an exception is thrown.
 55      * Parameter options:
 56      * @param {JXG.Point,array,function_JXG.Point,array,function} point1,point2 Parent elements
 57      * can be two elements either of type {@link JXG.Point} or array of
 58      * numbers describing the coordinates of a point. In the latter case the point
 59      * will be constructed automatically as a fixed invisible point.
 60      * It is possible to provide a function returning an array or a point,
 61      * instead of providing an array or a point.
 62      * @example
 63      * // Create a simple horizontal comb with invisible endpoints
 64      * var c = board.create('comb', [[1, 0], [3, 0]]);
 65      *
 66      * </pre><div class="jxgbox" id="951ccb6a-52bc-4dc2-80e9-43db064f0f1b" style="width: 300px; height: 300px;"></div>
 67      * <script type="text/javascript">
 68      * (function () {
 69      *   var board = JXG.JSXGraph.initBoard('951ccb6a-52bc-4dc2-80e9-43db064f0f1b', {boundingbox: [-5, 5, 5, -5], axis: true, showcopyright: false, shownavigation: false}),
 70      *     c = board.create('comb', [[1, 0], [3, 0]]);
 71      * })();
 72      * </script><pre>
 73      *
 74      * @example
 75      * var p1 = board.create('glider', [-3, 0, board.defaultAxes.x]);
 76      * var p2 = board.create('glider', [-1, 0, board.defaultAxes.x]);
 77      * var c1 = board.create('comb', [p1, p2], {width: 0.2, frequency: 0.1, angle: Math.PI / 4});
 78      *
 79      * </pre><div id="04186fd2-6340-11e8-9fb9-901b0e1b8723" class="jxgbox" style="width: 300px; height: 300px;"></div>
 80      * <script type="text/javascript">
 81      *     (function() {
 82      *         var board = JXG.JSXGraph.initBoard('04186fd2-6340-11e8-9fb9-901b0e1b8723',
 83      *             {boundingbox: [-8, 8, 8,-8], axis: true, showcopyright: false, shownavigation: false});
 84      *     var p1 = board.create('glider', [-3, 0, board.defaultAxes.x]);
 85      *     var p2 = board.create('glider', [-1, 0, board.defaultAxes.x]);
 86      *     var c1 = board.create('comb', [p1, p2], {width: 0.2, frequency: 0.1, angle: Math.PI / 4});
 87      *
 88      *     })();
 89      *
 90      * </script><pre>
 91      *
 92      */
 93     JXG.createComb = function(board, parents, attributes) {
 94         var p1, p2, c, attr, parent_types,
 95             ds, angle, width, p;
 96 
 97         if (parents.length === 2) {
 98             // point 1 given by coordinates
 99             if (Type.isArray(parents[0]) && parents[0].length > 1) {
100                 attr = Type.copyAttributes(attributes, board.options, 'comb', 'point1');
101                 p1 = board.create('point', parents[0], attr);
102             } else if (Type.isString(parents[0]) || Type.isPoint(parents[0])) {
103                 p1 =  board.select(parents[0]);
104             } else if (Type.isFunction(parents[0]) && Type.isPoint(parents[0]())) {
105                 p1 = parents[0]();
106             } else if (Type.isFunction(parents[0]) && parents[0]().length && parents[0]().length >= 2) {
107                 attr = Type.copyAttributes(attributes, board.options, 'comb', 'point1');
108                 p1 = Point.createPoint(board, parents[0](), attr);
109             } else {
110                 throw new Error("JSXGraph: Can't create comb with parent types '" +
111                     (typeof parents[0]) + "' and '" + (typeof parents[1]) + "'." +
112                     "\nPossible parent types: [point,point], [[x1,y1],[x2,y2]]");
113             }
114 
115             // point 2 given by coordinates
116             if (Type.isArray(parents[1]) && parents[1].length > 1) {
117                 attr = Type.copyAttributes(attributes, board.options, 'comb', 'point2');
118                 p2 = board.create('point', parents[1], attr);
119             } else if (Type.isString(parents[1]) || Type.isPoint(parents[1])) {
120                 p2 =  board.select(parents[1]);
121             } else if (Type.isFunction(parents[1]) &&  Type.isPoint(parents[1]()) ) {
122                 p2 = parents[1]();
123             } else if (Type.isFunction(parents[1]) && parents[1]().length && parents[1]().length >= 2) {
124                 attr = Type.copyAttributes(attributes, board.options, 'comb', 'point2');
125                 p2 = Point.createPoint(board, parents[1](), attr);
126             } else {
127                 throw new Error("JSXGraph: Can't create comb with parent types '" +
128                     (typeof parents[0]) + "' and '" + (typeof parents[1]) + "'." +
129                     "\nPossible parent types: [point,point], [[x1,y1],[x2,y2]]");
130             }
131         } else {
132             parent_types = parents.map(function(parent) { return "'" + (typeof parent) + "'"; });
133             throw new Error("JSXGraph: Can't create comb with parent types " +
134                 parent_types.join(", ") + "." +
135                 "\nPossible parent types: [point,point], [[x1,y1],[x2,y2]]");
136         }
137 
138         attr = Type.copyAttributes(attributes, board.options, 'comb', 'curve');
139         c = board.create('curve', [[0], [0]], attr);
140 
141         attr = Type.copyAttributes(attributes, board.options, 'comb');
142         ds = attr.frequency;
143         angle = -attr.angle;
144         width = attr.width;
145         if (attr.reverse) {
146             p = p1;
147             p1 = p2;
148             p2 = p;
149             angle = -angle;
150         }
151 
152         c.updateDataArray = function() {
153             var s = 0,
154                 max_s = p1.Dist(p2),
155                 cs = Math.cos(angle),
156                 sn = Math.sin(angle),
157                 dx = (p2.X() - p1.X()) / max_s,
158                 dy = (p2.Y() - p1.Y()) / max_s,
159                 x, y, f;
160 
161             // But instead of lifting by sin(angle), we want lifting by width.
162             cs *= width / Math.abs(sn);
163             sn *= width / Math.abs(sn);
164 
165             this.dataX = [];
166             this.dataY = [];
167             // TODO Handle infinite boundaries?
168             while (s < max_s) {
169                 x = p1.X() + dx * s;
170                 y = p1.Y() + dy * s;
171 
172                 // We may need to cut the last piece of a comb.
173                 f = Math.min(cs, max_s - s) / Math.abs(cs);
174                 sn *= f;
175                 cs *= f;
176 
177                 this.dataX.push(x);
178                 this.dataY.push(y);
179 
180                 this.dataX.push(x + dx * cs + dy * sn);
181                 this.dataY.push(y - dx * sn + dy * cs);
182 
183                 this.dataX.push(NaN);  // Force a jump
184                 this.dataY.push(NaN);
185                 s += ds;
186             }
187         };
188 
189         return c;
190     };
191 
192     JXG.registerElement('comb', JXG.createComb);
193 
194     return {
195         createComb: JXG.createComb
196     };
197 
198 });
199
